3: `1`ratchet`2`★来自法语 rochet ,线轴，纺锤，词源同 rock , rocket .引申词义棘轮。插入字母 t ,比较 bake , batch .`3` rock 	★来自古英语 rocc ,石头，岩石，词源同拉丁语 rocca ,岩石，词源不详。 ★来自古英语 roccian ,摇晃，摇摆，来自 Proto - Germanic * rukkon ,摇晃，纺纱，来自 PIE * rug ,纺纱，词源同 rocket , ratchet .引申词义摇滚乐。`3` rocket 	★来自意大利语 rocchetto ,纺纱轴，纺锤，烟花，火箭，来自 Proto - Germanic * rukkon ,摇晃，纺纱，来自 PIE * rug ,纺纱，词源同 rock .- etto ,小词后缀。比喻用法，因烟花，火箭形似纺锤体而得名。`3` bake 	★来自 PIE * bhe ,暖，热，词源同 bath .`3` batch 	★词源同 bake ,烘，烤。指同一批烤出来的面包。插入字母 t ,比较 watch ,词源同 wake .

4: Online Etymology Dictionary ratchet v. 1852, from  ratchet ,  n. . Transferred sense attested by 1977. Related:  Ratcheted ;  ratcheting . n. 1650s,  rochet , from French  rochet  "bobbin, spindle," from Italian  rocchetto  "spool, ratchet," diminutive of  rocca  "distaff," possibly from a Germanic source (compare Old High German  rocko  "distaff," Old Norse  rokkr ), from Proto-Germanic  *rukka- , from PIE root  *ruk-  "fabric, spun yarn." Compare  rocket ,  n. 2. Current spelling in English dates from 1721, influenced by synonymous  ratch , which perhaps is borrowed from German  Rätsche  "ratchet."

4: Online Etymology Dictionary 词根李平武蒋争 desolate adj. mid-14c., "without companions," also "uninhabited," from Latin  desolatus , past participle of  desolare  "leave alone, desert," from  de-  "completely" (see  de- ) +  solare  "make lonely," from  solus  "alone" (see  sole ,  adj. ). Sense of "joyless" is 15c. v. late 14c., from  desolate ,  adj. . Related:  Desolated ;  desolating . 〔李〕[de-;sol;-atea.] a.荒凉的，荒芜的； 孤寂的    ←sol (L solus)=alone 单独的 〔蒋〕[de-表示加强意义，sol单独，孤寂，-ate动词和形容词后缀;原义为:’to leave alone， to make lonely， hence to depopulate， to forsake”] 使孤寂，使荒凉，使荒芜，使无人烟，荒凉的

5: hub·bub     /   ˈhʌbʌb     ;           NAmE     ˈhʌbʌb     /         noun         [ singular         ,    uncountable         ]         1     the loud sound made by a lot of people talking at the same time           喧闹声；嘈杂声         ◆   It was difficult to hear what he was saying over the hubbub.   声音太嘈杂，难以听清楚他的讲话。         2     a situation in which there is a lot of noise, excitement and activity           喧闹；骚乱；混乱         ◆   the hubbub of city life   闹哄哄的城市生活             hub·bub     /   ˈhʌbʌb     ;           NAmE     ˈhʌbʌb     /

2: n.  ~ （against sb.） 你认为不公平的事、牢骚；怨气 air  ~ 述说抱怨； nurse a ~ 滋养怨气；

3: `1`grievance`2`★来自 grief ,悲痛。`3` grief 	★来自拉丁语 gravis ,重的，沉重，词源同 grave , gravity .

4: Online Etymology Dictionary grievance n. c.1300, "state of being aggrieved," from Old French  grevance  "harm, injury, misfortune, trouble, suffering," from  grever  "to harm, to burden" (see  grieve ). In reference to a cause of such a condition, from late 15c.

5: griev·ance     /   ˈɡriːvəns     ;           NAmE     ˈɡriːvəns     /         noun             grievance (against sb)             something that you think is unfair and that you complain or protest about         不平的事；委屈；抱怨；牢骚         ◆   Parents were invited to         air their grievances   (= express them) at the meeting.         家长们应邀在会上诉说他们的苦衷。       ◆   He had been         nursing a grievance against his boss for months.         他几个月来一直对老板心怀不满。       ◆   Does the company have a formal         grievance procedure   (= a way of telling sb your complaints at work)?     公司有正式投诉程序吗？       grievance   grievances           griev·ance     /   ˈɡriːvəns     ;           NAmE     ˈɡriːvəns     /

6: griev.ance grief n.悲痛；悲痛的事；忧虑 grieve : grief 的动词。

2: vi.  默然同意，勉强接受；

3: `1`acquiesce`2`★ ac -,去，往，- qui ,安静，词源同 quiet ,安静的。- esce ,起始动词后缀。引申词义默认。`3` quiet 	★来自拉丁语 quies ,静止，平和，休息，来自 PIE * kweie ,休息，安静，词源同 while , quit .

4: Online Etymology Dictionary acquiesce v. 1610s, from Middle French  acquiescer  (16c.), from Latin  acquiescere  "to become quiet, remain at rest," thus "be satisfied with," from  ad-  "to" (see  ad- ) +  quiescere  "to become quiet," from  quies  (genitive  quietis ) "rest, quiet" (see  quiet ,  n. ). Related:  Acquiesced ;  acquiescing .

5: ac·qui·esce     /   ˌækwiˈes     ;           NAmE     ˌækwiˈes     /         verb             [ intransitive         ]       acquiesce (in/to sth)             (         formal )         to accept sth without arguing, even if you do not really agree with it         默然接受；默认；默许；顺从         ◆   Senior government figures must have acquiesced in the cover-up.   政府高级官员必然已经默许掩盖真相。       acquiesce   acquiesces   acquiesced   acquiescing           ac·qui·esce     /   ˌækwiˈes     ;           NAmE     ˌækwiˈes     /

6: ac.qui安静esce动词后缀  ac.qui.esc.ence  名词 acquire v. 获得 ac.quaint.ance 熟人 acquit v. 宣判无罪；acquittal n. 无罪判决 -esce 构成动词，表述动作的开始

3: `1`condominium`2`★ con -,表强调，- dom ,管理，控制，词源同 domineer , domesticate .即共管区域。`3` con 	★来自短语 confidence   man  的缩写，反讽，被信任的人欺骗。`3` domineer 	★来自拉丁语 domus ,家，词源同 domain .即一家之主，专断。`3` domesticate 	★来自拉丁语 domus ,家，词源同 domain .即家养，驯养。

4: Online Etymology Dictionary 词根李平武蒋争 condominium n. c.1714, "joint rule or sovereignty," from Modern Latin  condominium  "joint sovereignty," apparently coined in German c.1700 from Latin  com-  "together" (see  com- ) +  dominum  "right of ownership" (see  domain ). A word in politics and international law until sense of "privately owned apartment" arose in American English 1962 as a special use of the legal term. 〔李〕[con-;domin;-iumn.] n.共同统治，共管    ←domin (L dominus)=owner, lord 主人

5: con·do·min·ium     /   ˌkɒndəˈmɪniəm     ;           NAmE     ˌkɑːndəˈmɪniəm     /       (   also     informal     condo   )         noun       (         especially NAmE )             an apartment building or group of houses in which each flat/apartment/house is owned by the person living in it but the shared areas are owned by everyone together; a flat/apartment/house in such a building or group of houses         公寓（套房私有，其他地方属业主共有）；公寓的套房；公寓的单元         condominium   condominiums           con·do·min·ium     /   ˌkɒndəˈmɪniəm     ;           NAmE     ˌkɑːndəˈmɪniəm     /
